name: Berserker Champion (Barbarian 24/ Fighter 6/ Champion of Torm 10)
author: NobleSky

posts.author: NobleSky
posts.content:
Build's description: This is an offensive tank/bulky melee type inspired by "Champion of Tribe" and "The HOOD" with heavy level in barbarian class made by Maximilian Kane. "Champion of Tribe" is geared for two-bladed sword build with two-weapon feats (ambidexterity, two-weapon fighting, and improved two-weapon fighting), terrifying rage, and dev.crit feat. On the other hand, "The HOOD" used stats increase with RDD (Red Dragon Disciple) 10 and have dev.crit, Terrifying + Mighty Rage, and 3 epic damage reduction feats. In "Berserker Champion" build, I aimed for dev.crit, 3 epic rage (Terrifying + Thundering + Mighty Rage), 3 epic damage reduction, and epic weapon specialization feats without RDD level.

Those feats can be taken with Half-Orc or Human race (Dwarf is another possibility because of +2 bonus to CON stats). Half-Orc has slightly overall stats compared to human while human has more skill points to invest even if they have same starting INT stat. If you prefer "Berserker Champion" with slightly better stats, go Half-Orc; but if you rather be skill-savvy, go human. Intimidate skill is to improve your success probability for Terrifying Rage, Spot or Listen (or both if you pick human race) is to avoid being surprised attack by the sneaky type, taunt is to annoy the opposing spellcaster. If taunt is not needed, it can be replaced with spellcraft skill for more will saving throw.

Fighter levels are for access to heavy armor, weapon specialization, and bonus feats. Champion of Torm (CoT) levels possess the advantages of more bonus feats up to 10 lvl and higher saving throw. When battle starts, you activate your rage (mighty rage at lvl 40), and charge to front-line. Even with CoT 10, your will and reflex saving throw are quite low ( 20 will and 22 reflex at lvl 40) so it will be nice if you can buff your DEX and WIS by potions or equipment (spell buff if you have spellcaster teammate). Nevertheless, the "Berserker Champion" can take many hits and hits back very hard.

At pre-epic levels, your lvl spread is Barbarian 18/ Fighter 1/ CoT 1. At mid-epic, the spread is Barbarian 20/ Fighter 4 (for WS feat)/ CoT 6 with EWS and dev.crit feats. Finally, at late-epic, your lvl spread is Barbarian 24/ Fighter 6/ CoT 10 with 3 epic damage reduction and 3 epic rage feats.

Soon, someone with more Barbarian experience will come along and help you polish this build.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
This looks pretty cool, an EDR III 688hp barbarian with 42 AB, dev crit DC 38-44 scythe with EWS, taunt, terrifying rage DC 43+1d10.
I like how you take Fighter 1 at level 2 for fast heavy armor proficiency in a low dex build, and transfer the bonus feats from Fighter 2 and CoT 2 to epic levels, where so many epic feats are taken.
Amazing fort save to be a little resistant against dev crit, death magic, implosions and petrify. Will and reflex saves are lowish but I think that could be expected with so many features and the class mix. +7 to will could be obtained with luck of heroes, iron will and epic will, but then it makes it harder to fit EDR III, dev crit and terrifying/mighty rage into the build.
AC is on the low side, I would consider swapping Thundering rage for armor skin, have a spare single handed weapon + tower in reserve.
Curious about the Cha 10, as you could put Int to 14 and Cha to 8? And put 20 cross-classed points in tumble for +4 AC, or spellcraft for extra saves vs spells. Unless I missed something.
Thundering rage could also be swapped for epic will, although that depends on the environment, whether one is in a party or not, whether there are mind immune items etc...
Thanks for sharing this!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
An interesting and bold concept, NobleSky - you've certainly gone for a full-on offense build!

The problem with that is the defence...you'll certainly be needing the DR with a horrible AC (which is a max of 17 if you're scything), because you'll be getting hit a lot - and let's not forget you'll lose a further 2 AC when Raging until you get Mighty Rage at level 40, but it will still apply to the 7 Greater Rages. I'm also a little concerned that your Intimidate stat is a bit meh for a heavy-Barb build, so your TR DC isn't what it could be. However, because you also go for Dev Crit, you have no feats to spare to help you defensively or with improving your Raging.

Thundering Rage is certainly not worth it, as Orion hints at, and could be dropped for Armour Skin for +2 to AC.

A few months ago I'd been working on a not dissimilar build (Barb 28/ F 4/ CoT 8 - Dwarf), with EDR III, Terry Rage and Mighty Rage, but without Dev Crit. It's not yet optimized, but I'll share it if you're interested.

Cheers

EDIT: Sorry, meant to mention: you'd be better off dropping Great Cleave down to level 18 and taking KD or Blind Fight at 9 (the other at 12). It might also be worth considering taking OCrit at L26, Dev Crit at 28, and dropping EWS down to 30.

posts.author: NobleSky
posts.content:
Thank you for the great inputs. If I find myself trying to have a new build concept, I will post it at the "Build Request/Unfinalized Build" segment.

To Orion, I made CHA 10 to prevent the -1 CHA penalty by going CHA 8, but perhaps that cost an improvement at essential stats. If a builder aims for Barbarian with Terrifying + Mighty Rage, minimum stats of STR 25 and CON 21 need to be reached. In the "Berserker Champion" mk.2, I set the CHA to 8 (for Half-Orc that meant CHA 6 due to -2 CHA penalty to race type). I set starting INT to 14 for Dwarf, 16 to Half-Orc so the starting INT would be 16 -2 = 14, and Human to 12  ). There are other tweaks in the starting STR and CON, but the final stats at lvl 40 would be STR 26 and CON 22. I abandoned Taunt (due to low CHA) for more invested skill points to Spellcraft + Tumble and the leftover points are gone to Heal skill. I agree that the toon should wear immune mind spell and immune death spell equipments for defensive purpose.

To Stagmeister, thanks for the input at the ordering of feats and advice for more defensive style. If needed, Scythe could be change to Bastard Sword because of the vampiric regeneration for little bits of HP regenerated upon successful  hit to enemy plus a tower shield. I would leave the weapon style to Scythe in my build section for the all-offense purpose but I leave a room for some tweaking around should other player have a different approach to their playstyle. Knockdown could be change to more defensive purpose such as Iron Will for slightly improved Will saving throw. I changed the level spread from Bb 24/ F 6/ CoT 10 to Bb 20/ F 10/ CoT 10. What did you miss by going from Bb 24 to Bb 20? You go from 5 to 4 damage reduction, 6 to 5 reflex save bonus from traps, and 1 to 2 bonus feats (from 4 new fighter levels). Other alternative is Bb 20/ F 6/ CoT 14 for slightly better overall saving throw at 38/22/24, not a radical improvement so I chose the Bb 20/ F 10/ CoT 10. Now there are 1 more free feat slot that we could invest further. In the new model, I swapped Thundering Rage for epic skill focus: Intimidate to improve my paltry Intimidate 42 to 50 (51 for Human race and 52 for dwarf race) and armor skin for the free feat slot.
(Note: I would like to see your Barbarian build if you would share it or give the build's name and I would search it in the Forum.)

I will post 3 models of "Berserker Champion mk.2" for Half-Orc, Human, and Dwarf races in 3 different posts, starting from Half-Orc in this post.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
If a builder aims for Barbarian with Terrifying + Mighty Rage, minimum stats of STR 25 and CON 21 need to be reached.
Mighty Rage (and Terrifying Rage) only require strength 21+, constitution 21+

So I think in your calculation, you are figuring in the requirements for Dev Crit here (which needs a 25+ Str).
